implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Defines the REST endpoint for creating a new task. Receives a TaskCreate object and delegates creation to the TaskService.
implementation.name: POST /tasks (create_task)
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a POST request is made to /tasks with task data:
    TRY
        Call task_service.create_task(task)
        RETURN created task
    EXCEPT Exception as e
        Raise HTTP 400 with error message

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles business logic for creating a task. Logs the operation and delegates to TaskRepository for persistence.
implementation.name: TaskService.create_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
Log 'Creating task for user: {user_name}'
Call repository.add_task(task_data)
RETURN created task

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements the storage logic for adding a new task. Assigns an ID, stores the task, logs creation, and returns the task object.
implementation.name: TaskRepository.add_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
Create Task object with new ID and fields from task_data
Append Task to internal task list
Increment ID counter
Log 'Task created: {task}'
RETURN created task
